TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit BuildItem extends System.Object

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Diagnostics.DebuggerDisplay("BuildItem (Name = { Name }, Include = { Include }, FinalItemSpec = { FinalItemSpec }, Condition = { Condition } )")

Docs.summary: Represents a single item in an [!INCLUDE[vstecmsbuild](~/add/includes/vstecmsbuild-md.md)] project.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An element in a project can represent multiple items through the use of wildcards. Therefore, each BuildItem object does not necessarily represent an `Item` element in the project.
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project> object and uses the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project.LoadXml%2A> method to add content to the project. The BuildItem, <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>, and <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroupCollection> classes are used to add, remove, and change items in the project.
[!code-vb[msbuild_AddNewItem#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/AddNewItem/Module1.vb#1)] [!code-cs[msbuild_AddNewItem#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/AddNewItem/Program.cs#1)]

Gets the number of custom attributes that are set on this item.
Docs.value: An integer indicating how many custom attributes are set on this item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value returned by CustomMetadataCount does include pre-defined or reserved item-spec modifiers, because they are not custom attributes.

Docs.summary: Gets all user-defined or custom attribute names.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> containing string names for all of the user-defined or custom attributes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks CustomMetadataNames does not include the names of non-user-defined or non-custom attributes.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the `Exclude` attribute value of the item.
Docs.value: Gets or sets the `Exclude` attribute value of the item.

Docs.summary: Gets the final specification of the item after all wildcards and properties have been evaluated.
Docs.value: The final specification of the item after all wildcards and properties have been evaluated.

Docs.returns: The value of the specified item metadata after after all item and property references have been evaluated.

## Examples The following example creates a <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project> object and uses the <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.Project.LoadXml%2A> method to add content to the project. The <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItem>, <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroup>, and <xref:Microsoft.Build.BuildEngine.BuildItemGroupCollection> classes are used to add, remove, and change items in the project.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the item was imported into the project.
Docs.value: if the item was imported into the project; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets the number of metadata set on the item
Docs.value: An integer representing the number of metadata items.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value returned by MetadataCount includes pre-defined or reserved item-spec modifiers as well as other metadata.

Docs.summary: Gets the names of metadata on the item, including pre-defined or reserved item-spec modifiers.
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> containing name strings of all metadata on the item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value returned by MetadataNames includes the names of all metadata, including user-defined and custom attributes.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the item collection to which the item belongs.
Docs.value: The name of the item collection to which the item belongs.

remarks.format:
